113.content:
Your mom comes into your room. She is happily humming a song as she looks down into your crib.

"How's mommy's special little guy?" She asks as she removes your restraints and lifts you out of your crib.

Your mother walked you over to a changing table. The changing table, like your crib, had not been in your room when you had gone to sleep. Your mother removed your clothing and then felt the front of your diaper.

"Oh dear, it looks like someone has already lost bladder control," Your mother laughed as she felt the soaked padding.

Something clicked in your head. Your mother knew what was going on. You tried to ask a question, but all that came out was baby babble.

Your mother guessing that you were full of questions smiled at you. She returned to humming her happy song as she removed your wet diaper, cleaned you off, and taped you into a dry diaper. Finally, she looked you in the eye and began to speak.

"We were selected for a top secret CIA program. They've developed the ability to regress people to infancy. In exchange for helping with this project, we're going to be paid over ten million dollars. Don't worry, the program only lasts one year and then you'll receive the antidote; unless you'd rather grow up naturally again. On the other hand, the CIA has some other experiments you could also be a part of. Nod if you understand."

You nod as your mother holds up her hands to you.

"Now, point to my right hand if you want to go along being a baby. Point to my left hand if you want to try more experiments."

1132.content:
You point to your mother's left hand. If you were going to be a baby for a year then you might as well participate in more experiments. Maybe you'll even get more money.

Your mother clapped and smiled at you. It almost seemed that she knew something about the experiments.

"The CIA is going to give us more money based on how many more experiments we participate in," Your mother explained. "The effects of the experiments will all be reversed once the year is over."

You nod your head to show that you understand.

"They gave me a suitcase with a bunch of vials of chemicals," Your mother continued. "Each vial will cause a different effect. Unfortunately, we won't get the antidote until the year is over; which means that the effects can't be undone."

Your mother continued to explain about the vials. There was a vial that would cause you to lose your memory and act like an actual baby for the entire year. There was a vial that would transform you into a girl. There was a vial that would cause your mother to lactate, requiring you to breastfeed. There was a vial that would immediately make you lose your bladder and bowel control; versus slowly losing it as your body adjusted to being a baby again. There were also several other vials that your mother talked about but you weren't really paying attention.

"Do you want to use all of the vials, or just a few?" Your mother asked. "Point to my right hand for all of the vials, or point to my left for only a few vials."

The girl looks down at you and you stop fidgeting. You look at up at her, and she is the very definition of an angel. Her neatly brushed blonde hair flowed down to her waist. She wore a white dress with a black belt.

As you stared at her you began to recognize her. She was a senior from your school. Kelly Something-or-other was her name. You didn't really know much about her because you were only a sophomore; however, you at least knew who she was.

"You probably don't remember me, but we go to school together," Kelly said as she reached into your crib and released you from your restraints. "I've been assigned to be your nanny for the next month. Don't worry, we're both going to get credit for this."

Your confused look must have clued Kelly into your lack of understanding.

"I'm in home economics," Kelly explained. "In order to graduate, and receive a full scholarship to Harvard, I need to pass this class with an A. Unfortunately, I'm not very good at the other parts of the class. This is my last chance to raise my grade up to an A."

You tried to speak, but again, all you could produce was gibberish. You still needed to communicate, so you pointed to yourself hoping Kelly would understand.

"As for why you're going to be my baby," Kelly continued, "You're being punished for all of the pranks you've pulled over the last two years. The school thought that it would be fitting for you to return to babyhood since you act like a baby anyways."

"Now, I really need this A, so if you're willing to be a good little baby for the next month then Mama Kelly can make it all worth your while," Kelly cooed as she carried you over to the rocking chair.

Kelly sat down in the rocking chair and began to rock you. Sitting next to the chair was a bottle full of formula. Kelly took the bottle and placed the nipple in your mouth.

You were starving but did not want to give in to the humiliation of being a baby for a month. On the other hand, Kelly did say she would make it worth your while.
